medical: EXAM: Ultrasound neck/soft tissue, head. HISTORY: Right-sided facial swelling and draining wound. TECHNIQUE AND FINDINGS: Ultrasound of the right mandibular region was performed. No focal collection is identified. This whole region appears to be phlegmonous. It is hard to adequately delineate the exact margins of this region. IMPRESSION: Abnormal appearing right mandibular region has more phlegmonous changes. No focal fluid collection. Had a discussion with Dr. xx. Consider CT for further evaluation.
layman:
Exam: Ultrasound of the neck, soft tissues, and head.  
History: Swelling on the right side of the face and a draining wound.  

Technique and Findings: An ultrasound was performed on the right side of the lower jaw. No clear pocket of fluid was seen. The area looks inflamed and swollen (phlegmonous). It is difficult to see the exact borders of the inflamed region.  

Impression: The right lower jaw area appears abnormal with increased inflammation. No clear fluid pocket. I discussed the results with Dr.â€¯xx. A CT scan may be helpful for further evaluation.
